examples: gardens of russet and gold chrysanthemums
the woods in autumn are a riot of russet and gold

noun.description: A dessert apple of a variety with a slightly rough greenish-brown skin.
A coarse homespun reddish-brown or gray cloth used for simple clothing.

verb.description: Make or become russet in color.

origin: Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French rousset, diminutive of rous red, from Provençal ros, from Latin russus red.
